>We both got really powerful, and for some reason we hired a slime, 
which proceeded to multiply itself many many times over. To take care 
of the problem of having so many allies, I had him run as far as he 
could, then I summoned the computer allies to me, laid a whole lot of 
bombs, released the computers, and ran. Five seconds later, there were 
only two of us on the team again 

Hehe.  I have a single slime on my team and I do have to worry about 
it multiplying.  Fortunately, between my barbarian and my archer, I 
can wipe out excess clones.  I called the slime "revenue" for obvious 
reasons.  The slime still has more health than the rest of time, even 
though the slime is still experience level 1 while the rest of the 
team is around experience level 266/267. [I do have a couple of 
conclusions: once you get your team members to the point of being able 
to access all their attacks, you can get a much better return on 
investment by spending money on factors other than experience levels. 
 There's more interconnectivity for stats than you realize.]

My entire team could walk on water without experience any loss in 
health due to walking to water.

So far, I've shrank the "The Inheritance", (#401 in my torture set) 
down to 83k and map size 58 by 59 in my quest to get things better for 
that number.  I'm gradually building it down and using the money to 
build up the team.
